text:
Seeing this error  while doing vagrant up. os is Fedora 24

```
==> default: Box 'hyperledger/fabric-baseimage' could not be found. Attempting to find and install...
    default: Box Provider: libvirt
    default: Box Version: 0.2.0
==> default: Loading metadata for box 'hyperledger/fabric-baseimage'
    default: URL: <https://atlas.hashicorp.com/hyperledger/fabric-baseimage>
The box you're attempting to add doesn't support the provider
you requested. Please find an alternate box or use an alternate
provider. Double-check your requested provider to verify you didn't
simply misspell it.

If you're adding a box from HashiCorp's Atlas, make sure the box is
released.

Name: hyperledger/fabric-baseimage
Address: <https://atlas.hashicorp.com/hyperledger/fabric-baseimage>
Requested provider: [:libvirt]
```

$ vagrant -v
Vagrant 1.8.1

VirtualBox Graphical User Interface
Version 5.1.8 r111374 (Qt5.6.1)
Copyright © 2016 Oracle Corporation and/or its affiliates. All rights reserved
Should I be able to build this without vagrant ?  Is there something in the vagrant images other than the env GO,Docker etc that I have locally ?
I got past that by specifying the provider to be virtualbox on the commandline and backing off to virtualbox 5.0

Now seeing on the make:
```
Makefile:107: recipe for target 'linter' failed
make: *** [linter] Error 1
vagrant@hyperledger-devenv:v0.2.0-865b0ed:/opt/gopath/src/github.com/hyperledger/fabric$
``
